docs.text: AIRR Knowledge Schema Common data model schema for the AIRR Knowledge Commons URI: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema Name: ak-schema Classes Class Description AIRRKnowledgeCommons A container for instances of multiple classes. AKObject Anything uniquely identifiable in the AKC. NamedThing Name and description for AKC things. Assay None TCellReceptorEpitopeBindingAssay None Assessment None BCellReceptor None Cell None Chain None Conclusion None Dataset None Epitope None PeptidicEpitope None ImmuneExposure An event involving the immune system of a study participant. ImmuneSystem None LifeEvent An event in which a study participant participates. Model None CommunicativeModel None ConceptualModel None ModelingFramework None Participant A participant in an investigation. PlannedProcess A process to realize a plan. Investigation A scientific investigation. Simulation None SpecimenCollection None PlanSpecification A plan with specified actions to meet some objectives. ModelSpecification None Specimen None StudyArm A population of participants of an investigation. StudyEvent An event that is part of the study design of an investigation. TCellReceptor None AlphaBetaTCR None GammaDeltaTCR None Tissue None SimilarityCalculation None ChainSimilarity None ForeignObject An object held outside of the AK. Reference A document about an investigation. docs.text: Class Description AIRRKnowledgeCommons A container for instances of multiple classes. AKObject Anything uniquely identifiable in the AKC. NamedThing Name and description for AKC things. Assay None TCellReceptorEpitopeBindingAssay None Assessment None BCellReceptor None Cell None Chain None Conclusion None Dataset None Epitope None PeptidicEpitope None ImmuneExposure An event involving the immune system of a study participant. ImmuneSystem None LifeEvent An event in which a study participant participates. Model None CommunicativeModel None ConceptualModel None ModelingFramework None Participant A participant in an investigation. PlannedProcess A process to realize a plan. Investigation A scientific investigation. Simulation None SpecimenCollection None PlanSpecification A plan with specified actions to meet some objectives. ModelSpecification None Specimen None StudyArm A population of participants of an investigation. StudyEvent An event that is part of the study design of an investigation. TCellReceptor None AlphaBetaTCR None GammaDeltaTCR None Tissue None SimilarityCalculation None ChainSimilarity None ForeignObject An object held outside of the AK. Reference A document about an investigation. V1p4Alignment None V1p4AlleleDescription None V1p4Cell None V1p4CellProcessing None V1p4Clone None V1p4Contributor None V1p4ContributorContribution None V1p4DataProcessing None V1p4DeletedGene None V1p4Diagnosis None V1p4DocumentedAllele None V1p4Expression None V1p4Genotype None V1p4GenotypeSet None V1p4GermlineSet None V1p4MHCAllele None V1p4MHCGenotype None V1p4MHCGenotypeSet None V1p4Node None V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing None V1p4PCRTarget None V1p4PhysicalQuantity None V1p4Reactivity None V1p4RearrangedSequence None V1p4Rearrangement None V1p4Receptor None V1p4Repertoire None V1p4RepertoireGroup None V1p4Sample None V1p4SampleProcessing None V1p4SequenceDelineationV None V1p4SequencingData None V1p4SequencingRun None V1p4Study None V1p4Subject None V1p4SubjectGenotype None V1p4TimeInterval None V1p4TimePoint None V1p4TimeQuantity None V1p4Tree None V1p4UndocumentedAllele None V1p4UnrearrangedSequence None

docs.text: name: V1p4_AlleleDescription from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema attributes: allele_descriptionallele_description_id: name: allele_descriptionallele_description_id annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Unique identifier of this AlleleDescription within the file. Typically, generated by the repository hosting the record. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: allele_descriptionallele_description_id owner: V1p4_AlleleDescription domain_of: - V1p4_AlleleDescription range: string required: true allele_descriptionallele_description_ref: name: allele_descriptionallele_description_ref annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Unique reference to the allele description, in standardized form (Repo:Label:Version) from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: allele_descriptionallele_description_ref owner: V1p4_AlleleDescription domain_of: - V1p4_AlleleDescription range: string required: false allele_descriptionacknowledgements: name: allele_descriptionacknowledgements annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: List of individuals whose contribution to the gene description should be acknowledged. Note that these are not necessarily identical with the authors on an associated manuscript or other scholarly communication. Further note that typically at least the three CRediT contributor roles "supervision", "investigation" and "data curation" should be assigned. The current maintainer should be listed first. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: allele_descriptionacknowledgements owner: V1p4_AlleleDescription domain_of: - V1p4_AlleleDescription range: V1p4_Contributor required: true multivalued: true allele_descriptionrelease_version: name: allele_descriptionrelease_version annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Version number of this record, updated whenever a revised version is published or released from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: allele_descriptionrelease_version owner: V1p4_AlleleDescription domain_of: - V1p4_AlleleDescription range: integer required: true allele_descriptionrelease_date: name: allele_descriptionrelease_date annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Date of this release from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: allele_descriptionrelease_date owner: V1p4_AlleleDescription domain_of: - V1p4_AlleleDescription range: string required: true allele_descriptionrelease_description: name: allele_descriptionrelease_description annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Brief descriptive notes of the reason for this release and the changes embodied from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: allele_descriptionrelease_description owner: V1p4_AlleleDescription domain_of: - V1p4_AlleleDescription range: string required: true allele_descriptionlabel: name: allele_descriptionlabel annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: The accepted name for this gene or allele following the relevant nomenclature. The value in this field should correspond to values in acceptable name fields of other schemas, such as v_call, d_call, and j_call fields. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: allele_descriptionlabel owner: V1p4_AlleleDescription domain_of: - V1p4_AlleleDescription range: string required: false allele_descriptionsequence: name: allele_descriptionsequence annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: Nucleotide sequence of the gene. generation protocol from a commercial provider, provide the protocol version number from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processinglibrary_generation_kit_version owner: V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing range: string required: true nucleic_acid_processingpcr_target: name: nucleic_acid_processingpcr_target annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: If a PCR step was performed that specifically targets the IG/TR loci, the target and primer locations need to be provided here. This field holds an array of PCRTarget objects, so that multiplex PCR setups amplifying multiple loci at the same time can be annotated using one record per locus. PCR setups not targeting any specific locus must not annotate this field but select the appropriate library_generation_method instead. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processingpcr_target owner: V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing range: V1p4_PCRTarget required: false multivalued: true nucleic_acid_processingcomplete_sequences: name: nucleic_acid_processingcomplete_sequences annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. `mixed` should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processingcomplete_sequences owner: V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing range: V1p4_CompleteSequences required: true nucleic_acid_processingphysical_linkage: name: nucleic_acid_processingphysical_linkage annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All `hetero_*` terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. `*_head-head` refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. `*_tail-head` refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processingphysical_linkage owner: V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing range: V1p4_PhysicalLinkage required: true

This should be either the assay utlizied in the experiment, delineated as "annotated" if annotated from an external source (e.g. IEDB), or inferred if imputed using a computational method. name: rearrangementsequence_id annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Unique query sequence identifier for the Rearrangement. Most often this will be the input sequence header or a substring thereof, but may also be a custom identifier defined by the tool in cases where query sequences have been combined in some fashion prior to alignment. When downloaded from an AIRR Data Commons repository, this will usually be a universally unique record locator for linking with other objects in the AIRR Data Model. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementsequence_id owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: true rearrangementsequence: name: rearrangementsequence annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: The query nucleotide sequence. Usually, this is the unmodified input sequence, which may be reverse complemented if necessary. In some cases, this field may contain consensus sequences or other types of collapsed input sequences if these steps are performed prior to alignment. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementsequence owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: true rearrangementquality: name: rearrangementquality annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: The Sanger/Phred quality scores for assessment of sequence quality. Phred quality scores from 0 to 93 are encoded using ASCII 33 to 126 (Used by Illumina from v1.8.) from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementquality owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangementsequence_aa: name: rearrangementsequence_aa annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Amino acid translation of the query nucleotide sequence. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementsequence_aa owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangementrev_comp: name: rearrangementrev_comp annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the alignment is on the opposite strand (reverse complemented) with respect to the query sequence. If True then all output data, such as alignment coordinates and sequences, are based on the reverse complement of 'sequence'. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementrev_comp owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: boolean required: true rearrangementproductive: name: rearrangementproductive annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the V(D)J sequence is predicted to be productive. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementproductive owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: boolean required: true rearrangementvj_in_frame: name: rearrangementvj_in_frame annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the V and J gene alignments are in-frame. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementvj_in_frame owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: boolean required: false rearrangementstop_codon: name: rearrangementstop_codon annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the aligned sequence contains a stop codon. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementstop_codon owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: boolean required: false rearrangementcomplete_vdj: name: rearrangementcomplete_vdj annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the sequence alignment spans the entire V(D)J region. Meaning, sequence_alignment includes both the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e., after the leader sequence) and the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e., before the J-C splice site). This does not require an absence of deletions within the internal FWR and CDR regions of the alignment. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementcomplete_vdj owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: boolean required: false rearrangementlocus: name: rearrangementlocus annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Gene locus (chain type). Typically, this value should be identical to `organism`, if which case it SHOULD NOT be set explicitly. However, there are valid experimental setups in which the two might differ, e.g. transgenic animal models. If set, this key will overwrite the `organism` information for all lower layers of the schema. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementlocus_species owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: V1p4_LocusSpecies required: false rearrangementv_call: name: rearrangementv_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: V gene with allele. V1p4_Rearrangement range: boolean required: false rearrangementj_frameshift: name: rearrangementj_frameshift annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the J gene in the query nucleotide sequence contains a translational frameshift relative to the frame of the J gene reference sequence. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementj_frameshift owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: boolean required: false rearrangementd_frame: name: rearrangementd_frame annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Numerical reading frame (1, 2, 3) of the first or only D gene in the query nucleotide sequence, where frame 1 is relative to the first codon of D gene reference sequence. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementd_frame owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: integer required: false rearrangementd2_frame: name: rearrangementd2_frame annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Numerical reading frame (1, 2, 3) of the second D gene in the query nucleotide sequence, where frame 1 is relative to the first codon of D gene reference sequence. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementd2_frame owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: integer required: false rearrangementconsensus_count: name: rearrangementconsensus_count annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Number of reads contributing to the UMI consensus or contig assembly for this sequence. For example, the sum of the number of reads for all UMIs that contribute to the query sequence. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementconsensus_count owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: integer required: false rearrangementduplicate_count: name: rearrangementduplicate_count annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Copy number or number of duplicate observations for the query sequence. For example, the number of identical reads observed for this sequence. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementduplicate_count owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: integer required: false rearrangementumi_count: name: rearrangementumi_count annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Number of distinct UMIs represented by this sequence. For example, the total number of UMIs that contribute to the contig assembly for the query sequence. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementumi_count owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: integer required: false rearrangementcell_id: name: rearrangementcell_id annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Identifier defining the cell of origin for the query sequence. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementcell_id owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangementclone_id: name: rearrangementclone_id annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Clonal cluster assignment for the query sequence. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementclone_id owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangementreactivity_id: name: rearrangementreactivity_id annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Comma separated list of unique identifiers for Reactivity objects associated with this Rearrangement. Order and length of reactivity_id and reactivity_ref are independent. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementreactivity_id owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangementreactivity_ref: name: rearrangementreactivity_ref annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Comma separated list of CURIE identifiers of external reactivity records (e.g. IEDB_RECEPTOR:182992, https://www.iedb.org/receptor/182992) associated with this Rearrangement. Order and length of reactivity_id and reactivity_ref are independent. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementreactivity_ref owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangementrepertoire_id: name: rearrangementrepertoire_id annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Identifier to the associated repertoire in study metadata. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementrepertoire_id owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangementsample_processing_id: name: rearrangementsample_processing_id annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Identifier to the sample processing object in the repertoire metadata for this rearrangement. If the repertoire has a single sample then this field may be empty or missing. If the repertoire has multiple samples then this field may be empty or missing if the sample cannot be differentiated or the relationship is not maintained by the data processing. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementsample_processing_id owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangementdata_processing_id: name: rearrangementdata_processing_id annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Identifier to the data processing object in the repertoire metadata for this rearrangement. If this field is empty than the primary data processing object is assumed. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementdata_processing_id owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false

docs.text: name: V1p4_Rearrangement from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema attributes: rearrangementsequence_id: name: rearrangementsequence_id annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Unique query sequence identifier for the Rearrangement. Most often this will be the input sequence header or a substring thereof, but may also be a custom identifier defined by the tool in cases where query sequences have been combined in some fashion prior to alignment. When downloaded from an AIRR Data Commons repository, this will usually be a universally unique record locator for linking with other objects in the AIRR Data Model. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementsequence_id owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: true rearrangementsequence: name: rearrangementsequence annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: The query nucleotide sequence. Usually, this is the unmodified input sequence, which may be reverse complemented if necessary. In some cases, this field may contain consensus sequences or other types of collapsed input sequences if these steps are performed prior to alignment. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementsequence owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: true rearrangementquality: name: rearrangementquality annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: The Sanger/Phred quality scores for assessment of sequence quality. Phred quality scores from 0 to 93 are encoded using ASCII 33 to 126 (Used by Illumina from v1.8.) from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementquality owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangementsequence_aa: name: rearrangementsequence_aa annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Amino acid translation of the query nucleotide sequence. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementsequence_aa owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangementrev_comp: name: rearrangementrev_comp annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the alignment is on the opposite strand (reverse complemented) with respect to the query sequence. If True then all output data, such as alignment coordinates and sequences, are based on the reverse complement of 'sequence'. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementrev_comp owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: boolean required: true rearrangementproductive: name: rearrangementproductive annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the V(D)J sequence is predicted to be productive. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementproductive owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: boolean required: true rearrangementvj_in_frame: name: rearrangementvj_in_frame annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the V and J gene alignments are in-frame. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementvj_in_frame owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: boolean required: false rearrangementstop_codon: name: rearrangementstop_codon annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the aligned sequence contains a stop codon. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementstop_codon owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: boolean required: false rearrangementcomplete_vdj: name: rearrangementcomplete_vdj annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the sequence alignment spans the entire V(D)J region. Meaning, sequence_alignment includes both the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e., after the leader sequence) and the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e., before the J-C splice site). This does not require an absence of deletions within the internal FWR and CDR regions of the alignment. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementcomplete_vdj owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: boolean required: false rearrangementlocus: name: rearrangementlocus annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Gene locus (chain type). Note that this field uses a controlled vocabulary that is meant to provide a generic classification of the locus, not necessarily the correct designation according to a specific nomenclature. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementlocus owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: V1p4_Locus required: false rearrangementlocus_species: name: rearrangementlocus_species annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Binomial designation of the species from which the locus originates. Typically, this value should be identical to `organism`, if which case it SHOULD NOT be set explicitly. However, there are valid experimental setups in which the two might differ, e.g. transgenic animal models. If set, this key will overwrite the `organism` information for all lower layers of the schema. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementlocus_species owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: V1p4_LocusSpecies required: false rearrangementv_call: name: rearrangementv_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: V gene with allele. If referring to a known reference sequence in a database the relevant gene/allele nomenclature should be followed (e.g., IGHV4-59*01 if using IMGT/GENE-DB). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementv_call owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: true rearrangementd_call: name: rearrangementd_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: First or only D gene with allele. If referring to a known reference sequence in a database the relevant gene/allele nomenclature should be followed (e.g., IGHD3-10*01 if using IMGT/GENE-DB). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementd_call owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: true rearrangementd2_call: name: rearrangementd2_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Second D gene with allele. If referring to a known reference sequence in a database the relevant gene/allele nomenclature should be followed (e.g., IGHD3-10*01 if using IMGT/GENE-DB). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementd2_call owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangementj_call: name: rearrangementj_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: J gene with allele. If referring to a known reference sequence in a database the relevant gene/allele nomenclature should be followed (e.g., IGHJ4*02 if using IMGT/GENE-DB). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementj_call owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: true rearrangementc_call: name: rearrangementc_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Constant region gene with allele. If referring to a known reference sequence in a database the relevant gene/allele nomenclature should be followed (e.g., IGHG1*01 if using IMGT/GENE-DB). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementc_call owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangementsequence_alignment: name: rearrangementsequence_alignment annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Aligned portion of query sequence, including any indel corrections or numbering spacers, such as IMGT-gaps. Typically, this will include only the V(D)J region, but that is not a requirement. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementsequence_alignment owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: true rearrangementquality_alignment: name: rearrangementquality_alignment annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Sanger/Phred quality scores for assessment of sequence_alignment quality. Phred quality scores from 0 to 93 are encoded using ASCII 33 to 126 (Used by Illumina from v1.8.) from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementquality_alignment owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangementsequence_alignment_aa: name: rearrangementsequence_alignment_aa annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Amino acid translation of the aligned query sequence. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementsequence_alignment_aa owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangementgermline_alignment: name: rearrangementgermline_alignment annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Assembled, aligned, full-length inferred germline sequence spanning the same region as the sequence_alignment field (typically the V(D)J region) and including the same set of corrections and spacers (if any). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementgermline_alignment owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: true rearrangementgermline_alignment_aa: name: rearrangementgermline_alignment_aa annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Amino acid translation of the assembled germline sequence. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementgermline_alignment_aa owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangementjunction: name: rearrangementjunction annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Junction region nucleotide sequence, where the junction is defined as the CDR3 plus the two flanking conserved codons. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementjunction owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - docs.text: Slot: allele_descriptionacknowledgements List of individuals whose contribution to the gene description should be acknowledged. Note that these are not necessarily identical with the authors on an associated manuscript or other scholarly communication. Further note that typically at least the three CRediT contributor roles "supervision", "investigation" and "data curation" should be assigned. The current maintainer should be listed first. docs.text: Slot: cell_processingcell_species Binomial designation of the species from which the analyzed cells originate. Typically, this value should be identical to species , in which case it SHOULD NOT be set explicitly. However, there are valid experimental setups in which the two might differ, e.g., chimeric animal models. If set, this key will overwrite the species information for all lower layers of the schema. Typically, this value should be identical to `species`, in which case it SHOULD NOT be set explicitly. However, there are valid experimental setups in which the two might differ, e.g., chimeric animal models. If set, this key will overwrite the `species` information for all lower layers of the schema. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: cell_processingcell_species domain_of: - V1p4_CellProcessing range: V1p4_CellSpecies required: false

docs.text: Slot: cloneclone_count Absolute count of the size (number of members) of this clone in the repertoire. This could simply be the number of sequences (Rearrangement records) observed in this clone, the number of distinct cell barcodes (unique cell_id values), or a more sophisticated calculation appropriate to the experimental protocol. Absolute count is provided versus a frequency so that downstream analysis tools can perform their own normalization. URI: ak_schema:cloneclone_count Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot V1p4Clone no Properties Range: Integer Identifier and Mapping Information Annotations property value nullable True Schema Source from schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self ak_schema:cloneclone_count native ak_schema:cloneclone_count LinkML Source name: cloneclone_count annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Absolute count of the size (number of members) of this clone in the repertoire. This could simply be the number of sequences (Rearrangement records) observed in this clone, the number of distinct cell barcodes (unique cell_id values), or a more sophisticated calculation appropriate to the experimental protocol. Absolute count is provided versus a frequency so that downstream analysis tools can perform their own normalization. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: cloneclone_count domain_of: - V1p4_Clone range: integer required: false

docs.text: Slot: germline_setacknowledgements List of individuals whose contribution to the germline set should be acknowledged. Note that these are not necessarily identical with the authors on an associated manuscript or other scholarly communication. Further note that typically at least the three CRediT contributor roles "supervision", "investigation" and "data curation" should be assigned. The coresponding author should be listed last. docs.text: Slot: nucleic_acid_processingcomplete_sequences To be considered complete , the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered complete & untemplated , the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. mixed should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value. URI: ak_schema:nucleic_acid_processingcomplete_sequences Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing no Properties Range: V1p4CompleteSequences Required: True Identifier and Mapping Information Annotations property value nullable False Schema Source from schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self ak_schema:nucleic_acid_processingcomplete_sequences native ak_schema:nucleic_acid_processingcomplete_sequences LinkML Source name: nucleic_acid_processingcomplete_sequences annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. `mixed` should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processingcomplete_sequences domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing range: V1p4_CompleteSequences required: true
docs.title: Slot: nucleic_acid_processingcomplete_sequences

docs.text: Slot: nucleic_acid_processingpcr_target If a PCR step was performed that specifically targets the IG/TR loci, the target and primer locations need to be provided here. This field holds an array of PCRTarget objects, so that multiplex PCR setups amplifying multiple loci at the same time can be annotated using one record per locus. PCR setups not targeting any specific locus must not annotate this field but select the appropriate library_generation_method instead. URI: ak_schema:nucleic_acid_processingpcr_target Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing no Properties Range: V1p4PCRTarget Multivalued: True Identifier and Mapping Information Annotations property value nullable False Schema Source from schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self ak_schema:nucleic_acid_processingpcr_target native ak_schema:nucleic_acid_processingpcr_target LinkML Source name: nucleic_acid_processingpcr_target annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: If a PCR step was performed that specifically targets the IG/TR loci, the target and primer locations need to be provided here. This field holds an array of PCRTarget objects, so that multiplex PCR setups amplifying multiple loci at the same time can be annotated using one record per locus. PCR setups not targeting any specific locus must not annotate this field but select the appropriate library_generation_method instead. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processingpcr_target domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing range: V1p4_PCRTarget required: false multivalued: true

docs.text: Slot: nucleic_acid_processingphysical_linkage In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct Rearrangements before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All hetero_* terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. *_head-head refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. *_tail-head refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. *_prelinked refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv). URI: ak_schema:nucleic_acid_processingphysical_linkage Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing no Properties Range: V1p4PhysicalLinkage Required: True Identifier and Mapping Information Annotations property value nullable False Schema Source from schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self ak_schema:nucleic_acid_processingphysical_linkage native ak_schema:nucleic_acid_processingphysical_linkage LinkML Source name: nucleic_acid_processingphysical_linkage annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All `hetero_*` terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. `*_head-head` refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. `*_tail-head` refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processingphysical_linkage domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing range: V1p4_PhysicalLinkage required: true

docs.text: Slot: reactivityreactivity_method The methodology used to assess/classify reactivity. This should be either the assay utlizied in the experiment, delineated as "annotated" if annotated from an external source (e.g. IEDB), or inferred if imputed using a computational method. In future versions we anticipate this field being an enumerated type, and it is strongly recommended that users utilize one of the following keywords in this field if appropriate: native_protein, MHC_peptide_multimer, annotated, inferred. docs.text: Slot: reactivityreactivity_readout Reactivity measurement read-out. For physical assays, this should describe what was measured. For inferred and annotated methods this should indicate a confidence/quality level for the inference/annotation. In future versions we anticipate this field being an enumerated type, and it is strongly recommended that users utilize one of the following keywords in this field if appropriate: fluorescence_intensity, barcode_count, confidence. docs.text: Slot: rearrangementcomplete_vdj True if the sequence alignment spans the entire V(D)J region. Meaning, sequence_alignment includes both the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e., after the leader sequence) and the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e., before the J-C splice site). This does not require an absence of deletions within the internal FWR and CDR regions of the alignment. URI: ak_schema:rearrangementcomplete_vdj Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot V1p4Rearrangement no Properties Range: Boolean Identifier and Mapping Information Annotations property value nullable True Schema Source from schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self ak_schema:rearrangementcomplete_vdj native ak_schema:rearrangementcomplete_vdj LinkML Source name: rearrangementcomplete_vdj annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the sequence alignment spans the entire V(D)J region. Meaning, sequence_alignment includes both the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e., after the leader sequence) and the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e., before the J-C splice site). This does not require an absence of deletions within the internal FWR and CDR regions of the alignment. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangementcomplete_vdj domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: boolean required: false

docs.text: Slot: rearrangementlocus_species Binomial designation of the species from which the locus originates. Typically, this value should be identical to organism , if which case it SHOULD NOT be set explicitly. However, there are valid experimental setups in which the two might differ, e.g. transgenic animal models. If set, this key will overwrite the organism information for all lower layers of the schema. docs.text: Slot: rearrangementquality The Sanger/Phred quality scores for assessment of sequence quality. docs.text: Slot: rearrangementsample_processing_id Identifier to the sample processing object in the repertoire metadata for this rearrangement. If the repertoire has a single sample then this field may be empty or missing. If the repertoire has multiple samples then this field may be empty or missing if the sample cannot be differentiated or the relationship is not maintained by the data processing. docs.text: Slot: rearrangementsequence_id Unique query sequence identifier for the Rearrangement. Most often this will be the input sequence header or a substring thereof, but may also be a custom identifier defined by the tool in cases where query sequences have been combined in some fashion prior to alignment. When downloaded from an AIRR Data Commons repository, this will usually be a universally unique record locator for linking with other objects in the AIRR Data Model. docs.text: Slot: repertoirerepertoire_id Identifier for the repertoire object. This identifier should be globally unique so that repertoires from multiple studies can be combined together without conflict. The repertoire_id is used to link other AIRR data to a Repertoire. Specifically, the Rearrangements Schema includes repertoire_id for referencing the specific Repertoire for that Rearrangement. docs.text: Slot: studycontributors List of individuals who contributed to the study. Note that these are not necessarily identical with the authors on an associated manuscript or other scholarly communication. Further note that typically at least the three CRediT contributor roles "supervision", "investigation" and "data curation" should be assigned. The coresponding author should be listed last. docs.text: Slot: studykeywords_study Keywords describing properties of one or more data sets in a study. "contains_schema" keywords indicate that the study contains data objects from the AIRR Schema of that type (Rearrangement, Clone, Cell, Receptor) while the other keywords indicate that the study design considers the type of data indicated (e.g. it is possible to have a study that "contains_paired_chain" but does not "contains_schema_cell"). "contains_schema" keywords indicate that the study contains data objects from the AIRR Schema of that type (Rearrangement, Clone, Cell, Receptor) while the other keywords indicate that the study design considers the type of data indicated (e.g. it is possible to have a study that "contains_paired_chain" but does not "contains_schema_cell"). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: studykeywords_study domain_of: - V1p4_Study range: V1p4_KeywordsStudy required: true multivalued: true

docs.text: Slot: studypub_ids Array of publications describing the rationale and/or outcome of the study as an array of CURIE objects such as a DOI or Pubmed ID. docs.text: Slot: subjectage_event Event in the study schedule to which Age refers. For NCBI BioSample this MUST be sampling . For other implementations submitters need to be aware that there is currently no mechanism to encode to potential delta between Age event and Sample collection time , hence the chosen events should be in temporal proximity. URI: ak_schema:subjectage_event Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot V1p4Subject no Properties Range: String Required: True Identifier and Mapping Information Annotations property value nullable True Schema Source from schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self ak_schema:subjectage_event native ak_schema:subjectage_event LinkML Source name: subjectage_event annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Event in the study schedule to which `Age` refers. For NCBI BioSample this MUST be `sampling`. For other implementations submitters need to be aware that there is currently no mechanism to encode to potential delta between `Age event` and `Sample collection time`, hence the chosen events should be in temporal proximity. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: subjectage_event domain_of: - V1p4_Subject range: string required: true
